Field Label: Please select all applicable symptoms reported in the history of the admission note to the hospital.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Convulsions/Seizures | 2, Cough | 3, Decreased Energy or lethargy | 4, Diarrhea (Loose Stool) | 5, Fast or noisy breathing or difficulty breathing | 6, Fever | 7, Headache | 8, Rash | 9, Neck Stiffness | 10, Runny nose (Coryza) | 11, Red eyes (Conjunctivitis) | 12, Vomiting | 13, Wheezing | 14, Other

Field Label: In question 1, it was indicated that this child had a cough. Please indicate the cough duration:
Did this child have at least 3 loose stools per day including the 24 hours prior to admission?
What was the duration of diarrhea or loss stool?
Has this child had exposure to a case of tuberculosis (household/close contact) within the last 12 months?
Does the admission history indicate that the child had any of the following clinical symptoms of pulmonary tuberculosis? Please select all applicable symptoms.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Persistent cough for > 2 weeks that is non-remitting | 2, Unexplained weight loss of > 5% weight reduction from highest weight recorded in last 3 months | 3, Documentation of downward crossing of weight or length growth curve trajectory in the preceding 3 months or weight-for-age z-score or length-for-age ≤ -2 in the absence of historical growth trajectory documentation and in the absence of response to nutritional rehabilitation or, if found to be HIV infected, to antiretroviral therapy | 4, Greater than 1 week of unexplained fever reported by caregiver | Persistent, unexplained lethargy or decrease in playfulness/activity reported by the caregiver | 5, None of the above

Field Label: Was there antibiotic use prior to the onset of diarrhea (loose stool)?
Was a non-infectious cause of diarrhea (loose stool) identified by the caregiver or clinician upon admission?
Was there a confirmed measles outbreak in the area at the time of the child's hospitalization
